Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freddie v
Reviews.Content: We loved every moment at this hotel. Even though there was no room available to us when we arrived early the morning our luggage was kept safely. Our Superior room was just excellent - huge for a European hotel. We felt like royalty in our room. The hotel is really a 2 minute walk to the Metro and we used the metro extensively - it's the only way to see Paris. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was pleasant enough. LOVED this hotel and the location. Highly Recommended. To get to the hotel from CDG: buy a Paris Visite card - you won't regret it and will use it often. Take RER B (regional line which you'll see if you follow the train signs). Get off at Gare du Nord. Walk to Magenta station on RER E. Take RER E in the direction of Haussmann Saint-Lazare and get off at this station. Walk to Line 3 and take the train towards Becon. Get off at Porte de Champerret. Walk up the stairs. When you get outside go left and cross a street to continue down Berthier Boulevard. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Everything to sleep and feel well : new, clean, quit and smartly designed”
Reviews.Author: BBojo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near Metro, 6 stations far from Opera, in a good and safe neighborhood. Our room was, i think, the smallest of the hotel but was still big enough to live. Our rates was really good. The internet connection is free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Gosisd
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this lovely place for 2 nights during March 11-13. It was a business trip for me. I got there by Taxi straight from the airport around 2PM. The check in process was quick (2minutes) and it was nice that they didn't ask to see my passport. Looking at the lobby already gives you the understanding that it's a different place. A piano in the center.. Nice seating area with very nice lights. Speaking of lights.. The room numbers are shown on the floor at the entrance to your room, with special light effects. Great add on! I stayed on the second floor, in Room 24. There is an elevator in the hotel. Free WiFi in the room and in the rest of the hotel as well. The room was kind of petit, but is very clean and well organized. LCD TV on the wall, Safe in the closet, fridge and a nice working table. Nice surprise was a complimentary Avian bottle of water welcoming you in your room. It could have been nice if was given daily however. My room hade the bathroom separated from the toilet. It is nice, but kind of weird as it was on both sides of the room, when the toilet was next to the window, across the bed.. Breakfast: Wow, it was great! Many options to choose from, including hot dishes, such as scrambled eggs and sausages. Fresh juice, pastry, fruit salad, yogurt, cut your cheese plate and much more. Location: Metro (Line # 3) is 3 minutes from the hotel. Turn right from hotel exit and just walk 3 minutes straight to the metro station (Porte de Champerret). The hotel is located 15 minutes walk to the Etoile (Arc De Triomphe) and Avenue Due Champs Elysees. My meetings were at Levallois Perret business area, and I managed to walk from the hotel (15 minutes) and explore nice areas of Paris that I didn't see before. Many nice places to eat all around the hotel, and on the way to the Etoile. Will recommend to others and hopefully will have the chance to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely :)”
Reviews.Author: Woodchopper81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel De Banville for three nights, one of which was my 30th birthday. The trip was a gift from my girlfriend. What a lovely surprise it was too. On the morning of my birthday, in our room, I proposed to my girlfriend and got a yes! So, as you may expect I have nothing but good memories about the hotel and my time in Paris. Our room was a superior room and was beautifully decorated. It was fairly small but big enough for what we needed. The only downside was the sound of the lift squeaking but that didn't bother us. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are many lovely eateries dotted about near by. Although it is fairly expensive it is, in my opinion, worth it. I plan to book the same room for my fiancé an I on her 30th birthday next year :)

Reviews.Title: “A stay to remember”
Reviews.Author: davidramsbottom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 'Maries Apartment', the hotels top floor suite and it was everything I had hoped for. It was spacious, clean, extremely well designed and the views of the city were stunning. The breakfast was wonderful and the staff were both friendly and incredibly accommodating. As I wanted to surprise my girlfriend with a proposal on the balcony, they conspired with me to have everything just right. If you're looking for a very cool, boutiquey, friendly hotel in Paris - look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judah and Carla C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon, and it was definetely fitting! Beautiful rooms, with bathtubs in the rooms, we had a Les pastourelles room. The breakfast in the morning is very good, more than usual continental style breakfast with cold cuts, bacon and eggs, and the service we received was very good. We had one bad experience with the male receptionist working the night we arrived, who was very rude and curt and refused to give us the room we had requested in advance and who gave us an inferior classic room, insisting we would like it. We didn't, very begrudgingly he found us another classic room which was a vast improvement. Since we were only there 2 nights we were very disappointed. However, the following morning, the Very friendly and helpful lady working at the reception allowed us the room promised and was very apologetic. Since our subsequent treatment was very good, I would recommend this hotel, as a spacious retreat in the heart of Paris, romantic and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Kassiopea
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located at 5 min walking from the metro station,20 min by metro to center of Paris and 30 min (with no traffic) by taxi to CDG airport.the lobby is small but very warm and cozy and once a week(Tuesday if I recall well - live music). Rooms are nice, very clean,spacious for the parisian standards,there is free wifi, our room had no bathtub but a spacious shower.Personel is very helpful and kind. Good value also ( for Paris :). I'd like to return.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supermensch
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Paris for work, I had a reservation at another hotel which got cancelled. My French host frequents this hotel and managed to get a room for me at the last minute. I couldn't have been more pleased - this is an absolutely lovely boutique hotel. From the moment I entered the door the entire experience was nothing short of exceptional. Located on a quiet street in the 17th arr., the hotel is only two minutes away from the metro with plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, as well as very accommodating. The lobby, which also served as the breakfast room, was comfortable with chairs and tables, and introduced a comfortable feeling carried into the rooms. My room had high ceilings, with a dividing wall between the bathroom and sleeping area that was open at the top, creating a more airy feeling. The decor was clean and contemporary with a french flair. The entire hotel - rooms and lobby - were quiet and calming. Breakfast was typical continental, with fresh croissants and bread and an assortment of other fresh foods. Overall I can not recommend this hotel enough if you are looking for a place to get away from the noise, hustle and bustle of Parisian tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel with musical events”
Reviews.Author: Flateric09
Reviews.Content: This Hotel in the 17th arrondissement of Paris is close to the Periphery however with very little traffic noise. The surrounding area is nice with more residential feel to it then the busy and bubbly atmosphere in the tourist areas of Paris. Go to the park "Jardin, Boulevard Pereire" at walking distance for some stress release in the city. Rooms are well equipped with a good and modern shower. During my stay a music concert was given in the Hotel lobby by the owners. Something not often seen therefore you should have a look. The hotel has a good breakfast in the lobby and no restaurant service. Several good restaurants are close to the Hotel such as the Restaurant "Meating" at 122 Avenue de Villiers. There is a below ground parking close to the Hotel where your car is treated with respect and cleaned if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, beautiful rooms, great service! Treated like a queen”
Reviews.Author: Gemmalee1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a birthday celebration and the staff did everything to make my stay rememberable! The room was so luxurious and clean! Really close to the metro and surrounded by lovely restaurants a short walk. Breakfast very yummy! Will definately be back one day :)

Reviews.Title: “Cute and very cozy”
Reviews.Author: emaock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple nights, it's an adorable hotel. The rooms were on the smallish side, especially the room for the toilet . . . it was a tiny little closet with just the commode, bath/shower and sink were in a separate room. Very nicely decorated rooms, you really felt like you were in Paris, especially with the partial view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. Small balconies on the front of the building were nice to have, rooms were clean and service was good. Upper floors are accessible by a traditional Parisian elevator or the beautiful circular staircase. We'd stay here again. The location was a tiny bit further from the sights, but the price was right and we only had to walk a few more blocks. The Metro station is very close and there is a great bakery down the street too, just past the cheese shop in the opposite direction of the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: tim_r_jones
Reviews.Content: Clean, well presented rooms in a lovely building. Area has heaps of great restaurants, and the arc de triomph is about a 30 minute stroll. Metro is only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. We loved the fact that the hotel was not in a tourist trap kind of area. Lots of locals doing what parisians do. The staff on reception were very friendly, helpful and spoke good english. Great value for Paris. Highly recommended. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small, but nice”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: Very small, but nice hotel with a great, friendly desk staff. Beds had a foot board and my son and I are well over 6' tall. The staff upgraded us to a larger room without foot boards the next night - well appreciated!!!!! Continental breakfast was very good, but hot dishes are not recommended. Metro stop about 4 blocks away, but distance really isn't that far to walk. Plenty of restaurants nearby for average food ( if you are after super expensive food, you'll have to look elsewhere).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Gareth W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and close to the Metro. When we arrived we were wonderfully greeted by the receptionist Elodie. She was very helpful and extremely friendly. The room was well sized, beautifully decorated and with a delightful bathroom. The room was made though with the superb view from the large double windows. Looking out over the Paris skyline at the Eiffel Tower. Going to sleep looking at an illuminated Eiffel Tower really is rather special. My girlfriend and eye were delighted with the whole trip and hotel. We would absolutely love to go back to the Hotel de Banville.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobdobb
Reviews.Content: Located on the Left Bank, this boutique hotel is perfectly situated. Near to the metro (Porte de Champarret) and a host of typical Parisian cafes, this hotel is ideal for seeing the sights. The hotel is quirky, yet tasteful and the rooms are well furnished. The staff are polite and helpful; particularly the new, French, female receptionist - nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Got the job done but was rude”
Reviews.Author: ravenbear65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 days at this hotel and some of the staff (Bell person in particular) was very rude. Some wouldn't look at us when we asked them a question and totally ignored us (probably because we are not from France) but gushed over other guests that were. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great value.”
Reviews.Author: StevenmSE27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and really enjoyed it, managed to get a good rate from lastminute.com and was really impressed with the whole package. The room we had was was great and a good size and the service was superb on every level, reception very helpful and friendly and the barman makes a great mojito!! Location not so central but it is very close to metro and we found we could be in most parts of the city within 15 to 20 minutes, cabs from centre of the city after the Metro had closed cost approx. 10 EURO which again was good value. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there is a very good local bakery just across the street. if you are looking for an excellent 4star base while in paris this is certainly the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it cant wait to get back!”
Reviews.Author: aliciachapman
Reviews.Content: Staff were lovely, couldnt do enough for you. Room was amazing has a nice view of the tower. Couldnt have asked for anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but the basic rooms are disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Louise_26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet tree-lined street a short walk from the nearest tube and a longer but enjoyable walk to the Arc-de-Triomphe and on to other attractions. We walked to the Eiffel Tower a few times and as other reviews say it's quite a distance but the route is lined with charming cafes, restaurants and other sites so a nice way to experience the city. The communal areas in the hotel were nice but while our room was fine it was nothing special. It might have been less disappointing had the hotel's website shown more representative photos but as it was the fairly dark bedroom and small bathroom (which floods each time you have a shower) did not live up to our expectations. I travel a lot and thought that it was relatively poor value for money. The hotel was clean, the bed was very comfy, and the staff were very friendly. If you intend to stay here and can afford to then I'd suggest that you pay a bit more for a superior room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryGoCruise
Reviews.Content: Excellent, great service and breakfast.lovely rooms and not far from the center of Paris walking distance of the Champes Elsysee

Reviews.Title: “Pretty boutqiue hotel with a romantic feel”
Reviews.Author: em_draper1
Reviews.Content: - Location. Very close to the tube station and between 5-10 stops from the main attractions. Very reliable tube system so we got around very easily. There's a supermarket and lots of restaurants and cafe's also nearby. - Staff. The lady who checked us in gave me a standard room when we had paid for a superior room up-front. I had to question this and it was soon rectified and i hope not something that was done on purpose. The cleaners and staff around the hotel were all very friendly and helpful. - The room. We stayed in a superior suite at around 170 euros per night and it was definitely worth the money. We had a huge free standing bath and large bed of two twins pushed together. It was a lovely room and very uniquely decorated making it feel more like your own home and not a souless hotel room. - Helpful hints. Get a book of 10 tube tickets from the station for around 12 euro's it works out much cheaper than buying single tickets. Don't go for the hotel breakfast at 20 euro's per person (outrageously expensive) when there are lovely patisserie's around the hotel where you can get a tastey croissant and coffee from 3 euros. If you're staying on the Tuesday night be aware they have a live music night (music wasn't to my taste) and even on the third floor kept us awake until past midnight. Splash out on a couple of nights in a good quality restaurant, and save where you can by having picnic's under the eiffel tower and buying wine from the supermarket, otherwise the 8 euro beers and 20-30 euro main courses really start to drain your budget! Overall a great hotel that i would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely service, great location, but needs soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: LDNTraveller05
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. The location was great, and the staff were absolutely lovely, rooms were nice and modern if a bit small - but nicely decorated. They noticed we were on our honeymoon and upgraded us to a suite immediately which was very nice. The only thing I will say is that the floors/ceilings need soundproofing. At 11.30pm the guy in the room above us was talking loudly on his phone and we could hear every word of his half of the conversation, which was keeping us up. The woman at the front desk agreed to go up to the room and speak to him, which did help. Also, any time a toilet flushed near our room, we could hear the pipes going. Also, the bathroom did not have a shower screen which did mean that the bathroom got a bit flooded when we showered, but this could be easily solved by hanging a screen or curtain. But i must say the staff were absolutely lovely and helpful. The place is a little gem and good value - if they can just put some soundproofing in - this place will be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, total comfort and very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: flowerpower13
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me here for a surprise 30th birthday weekend away, and we were not disappointed. Its situated in a lovely part of Paris, on the outskirts of town, but easy to reach most attractions. We went back and forth to the centre many times on the metro, and we enjoyed walking past glorious little bakeries on the way back to the hotel. There were many 5 star restaurants close by, and a couple of authentic places to enjoy breakfast. The staff were welcoming and friendly. Our wifi didnt work in our room, so they upgraded us to a larger room for free. Rooms were a good size, quiet and comfortable. Staff suggested good places to eat, and arranged taxis for us. The breakfast was a little over priced, so we opted to eat at a little cafe 5 minutes walk towards the metro station. Firstly we had a room with a window onto a court yard which was quiet, we then moved to a room with a view of the main road, which was a little less quiet but didnt disturb our sleep. A great place for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but also efficient boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JR035
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Hotel de Banville and had a very enjoyable stay. The staff are very friendly but also extremely efficient. We felt very welcome striaght away. I had a lovely superior room, which although was on the small side it was well equipped. The area had a fantastic restaurent called Petrus which was about a 5 minute walk and mainly served fish and seafood. The atmosphere was pleasant but again super efficient. The food was excellent if a little pricey. Overall I can definitely say I would return again for both business but also with the family. Thank you Hotel de Banville!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly remote, but well worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: ddd052
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Hotel de Banville and would not hesitate recommending the hotel for a romantic, escape. This boutique hotel is very, very charming aw well as bright, clean, well designed, contemporary, romantic, warm and welcoming. Hotel staff are professional, friendly, welcoming and very helpful. The hotel is in a wonderful neighborhood with an excellent selection of restaurants. The only slightly negative comment I'd have is the hotel was a few metro stops from the Marais, museums and St Germain. But, the Paris tube is excellent, so this wasn't too big a deal. It was a warm and welcoming room to come back to each day.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Warmheart
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend at the Hotel de Banville with 3 friends and we could not recommend it highly enough. After nearly having my purse stolen after being in Paris for 5 minutes it was great to arrive in this Oasis of calm - a beautiful hotel in a beautiful area. Our twin rooms were very tastefully decorated - one overlooked a courtyard at the back - not the best view in the world but the room was lovely - my friends' room overlooked the front street and was also very comfortable. Everyone we encountered either on reception, housekeeping or the gentleman who brought our bags to the room were very helpful and friendly. The metro is only a three minute walk away and there are various restaurants/coffee shops nearby if you don't want to go far. We walked to a small Sunday morning market which Bruno on reception told us about and had lunch in one of the many restaurants en route. We booked on the Eurostar website and got a very good deal and hopefully will return soon. If you arrive at the Gare du Nord do take a taxi to the hotel rather than the metro - we had to get 3 trains to the hotel and it was only 1 stop from the Gare du Nord that the attempt was made to steal my purse. It was only 24 euros to get a taxi back at the end of our stay - well worth it! Thank you to everyone at the Hotel de Banville for a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sarah347
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel De Banville on 12th October having travelled the night before. Unfortunately as we bring forward the day of our arrival, due to strike action in Paris, I decided that we would stay in a lower star hotel in order to break our journey up. The old adage you get what you pay for has never been more true! When we arrived at this hotel we were greeted by Jacques the night manager who despite having already worked who knows how many hours was very accomodating and welcoming, allowing us to check in early and begin our Paris adventures. This is a boutique hotel and all the rooms have been individally designed which I love. Having to travel a lot with work I do not want to come away to a carbon copy room/hotel. Some people may be concerned with the so called out of the way location in actual fact we found this to be an advantage as we were away from the bustle and could relax, but within walking distance or a short metro journey to all the major sights. For those who may not want to spend their time walking to places, which in my mind would be a pity for them, there is a metro station literally 2 minutes from the hotel. Simply buy your carnet of tickets and you can be off anywhere you like metro map in hand. A short walk (less that 10 minutes) also gets you to a number of restaurants (including those of the michelin star variety) as well as affordable bistros. What more could you ask for. If you like the personal touch this is the hotel for you. You may think that you can save yourself a few pounds staying somewhere cheaper or a few minutes staying closer to the sights but in my opinion you would be missing out on what to my mind must be one of Paris' best kept secrets!

Reviews.Title: “A great business/personal stay!"”
Reviews.Author: winnicandle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Banville for 3 weeks this summer on a combined business/personal trip with my wife. The room was very large (Theodore de Banville Room) and was very comfortable. It was well decorated for the price and we loved that it had 2 sinks and good Air Conditioning. A/C did go out for a short period and reception kept us updated and it was fixed promptly. They also provided a fan which was sufficient. We very much liked the location - its not in the crazy area of Paris - its about a 15 min walk to the Champs, or a 2 min walk to the Metro. It was very nice to come back to a quiet neighborhood in the evening. There is also great restaurants within walking distance. I sometimes stay in MontMartre if we want more action - but really love the peace and quiet in the neighborhood around Hotel de Banville. The staff was very friendly, especially the breakfast server, who always had a smile and always knew what I wanted! - and the breakfast is always fresh, a good selection, and incredible breads! A great value. My only complaint is the hotel taxi. I used taxis daily and this was the only time I felt ripped off. He agreed to take one of us to CDG airport for 50E and to drop me off at Le Bourget airport on the return. Said he would still make it back for his next pick up..OK...but at Le Bourget he wanted another 48E as said he might miss his next fare. We made great time he wasn't missing anything....so congrats - you ripped me off, I hope the hotel takes note and stops using you! Anyhow - small detail and not the hotel fault....Banville is a great stay, I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next trip to Paris! Its a lovely spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel, friendly staff, quiet location. Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: andyfox42
Reviews.Content: We booked over the intrenet and got the reduced rate for a Superior Room (about Euros 170) as opposed to 350, still a lot of money but compared to the rest of Paris very reasonable. The room was big, clean and stylishly decorated, including free WI-Fi (based in room so no signal problems) and flat screen TV. The connecting bathroom had a large bath (enough for 2!) and was very clean. Thee hotel staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful in every way from the moment we entered to the moment we left. The inclusive breakfast was an informal buffet and again was excellent - fresh juice and coffee included and also eggs, bacon, pastries, bread etc. Its ina quiet location, and has a persnal feel to it - its not a big hotel and so never busy. It is literally 2-3 minutes from the nearets metro, or 15min walk to Arc De Triomphe. Would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Hardest Bed in the World”
Reviews.Author: savannahsara
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why we didn't switch hotels. .Everyone has a preference when it comes to how hard or soft they like a mattress. The beds at the Hotel de Banville are some of the hardest I have ever come in contact with. My friend and I slept on the floor rather then toss and turn all night on our double beds. While relaxing on the lawn in front of the Louvre my friend shared with me that the lawn was most certainly softer then her bed. I once stayed in a convent in New Mexico and the nuns there have softer beds. We inspected our mattress at night and I believe there was a wooden board under the case but I can't be sure. That bed just didn't give. The linens were somehow ironed to the bed and I believe one was expected to sleep over the comforter. If it sounds weird it's because it was. I would not recommend any kind of intimacy in that bed for safety purposes. Men booking their honeymoon should be advised. The hotel advertises being, "10 Minutes from the Arc de Triomphe" That's not helpful as the Arc de Triomphe is a long walk to many other attractions. Service was unfriendly. I had trouble connecting to the wifi and the mean man who watches the place at night got snippy on the phone. This is a very loud hotel and in the early morning it sounds as if someone is emptying the china closet by playing frisbee. One woman at reception kept giving us the wrong directions. Over time we discovered she had left and right confused. They suggested we ride the metro to Versailles which is not good advice when their is a high speed train available. While it was a relatively clean room we found a pair of someone else's shoes behind a chair. At checkout the receptionist allowed our taxi meter to keep running up a tab while she settled the ten euro bill from the minibar. We began our journey to the airport with 14 euros on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the money and poor location...”
Reviews.Author: SianHead
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for our honeymoon and was slightly disappointed. We paid for a superior room which was pleasing on the eye but quite small. This hotel has the potential to be outstanding but there are so many small details that need to be addressed... 1 - our room was slightly damp smelling because of the bathroom being open plan 2 - the slippers provided for our room had imprints in them from the previous occupant 3 - the towels and robes are clean but look old 3 - the wallpaper in some places was coming away from the wall 4 - the breakfast is extremely over priced 2 MAJOR points to make is 1 - the location is pretty poor - a good 10 euro taxi away from anywhere half decent 2 - do NOT order a taxi at reception. VERY expensive as they arrive with meter already running. instead walk down the street to the nearest taxi point (pretty much everywhere in the city) However saying that - we had no problem with noise (remember you are in a city) and the staff seemed friendly. Beds are dressed in white sheets and are extremely comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JimmyDubai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for the second time in August. Once again the hotel was fantastic. We received an upgrade on check in which was great. The staff were helpful and ensured we had everything to enjoy out stay. Great hotel, great location, great rooms. the best hotel to stay in while in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, friendly staff, nice location”
Reviews.Author: BeverleyT
Reviews.Content: The only downside to our trip - were were only there one night! This hotel is gorgeous, super-cute and the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are varied - the one we were in (number 22), was a very traditional style with twin beds and was really cute/pretty. We totally loved this hotel which was literally 2 mins from the metro and 10-15 mins walk from the Arc De Triomphe. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a beautiful hotel in a peaceful area - we'll definately stay again!!! Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and loved the renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Benched1
Reviews.Content: We were allocated room 21 for our stay which was recently renovated. Very contemporary design and spacious considering the actual size of the room. Bathroom was nice except for the nearly see through door which lack a little privacy. We didn't eat at the hotel but had a glass of wine which was on the expensive side. All the staff we encountered were very efficient. Organised a late check out til 9pm and were charged 100EUR which we didnt think was too bad. About 15 minutes walking distance to the Champs and plenty of restaurants around to eat. My only gripe would be that we didnt have an umbrella available when it rained. Would recommend and especially if you can get it for 215AUD a night.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and (relativly) centrally located”
Reviews.Author: jocoon
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with renovated rooms (with names). We stayed in Juliet on the top-floor. Not any view from that room, but if you are lucky you might change rooms and get one with a better view over Paris. We didn´t have breakfast at the hotel, but used a small café with continental breakfast for 11 euro. Would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not advise for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: manninjj
Reviews.Content: As I was travelling for business I am unsure as to whether my experience was linked to the fact that I was more conscious of efficient service etc. but generally I was disappointed in this hotel for a few reasons: 1. When I arrived, the attendant at the front desk was counting out money and completely ignored me despite the fact that I was blatantly standing in front of him for a good 2 minutes (keep in mind it was almost midnight and I was exhausted). 2. I asked if someone could help me with me bags - the attendant's response was "no, but I can push the elavator button for you." 3. I got to my room (delux), which was reasonably sizeable for a room in Paris (albeit a little kitchy, you wouldn't want to be an epileptic looking at the wallpaper), however was disappointed by the fact that the shower was not attached to the wall - it was one of those old fashioned ones attached to the bath. Also, there was no vanity mirror and lighting in the bathroom was poor. There was also no plug near a mirror (for anyone who wants to blow-dry their hair). 4. I realised (annoyingly) as I was getting into bed that the two bed-side lights wouldn't turn off - so I had to re-dress and call down to reception. The attendant sounded annoyed I was bothering him, and said he would be right up; 20 minutes later (at this stage it was almost 1 am), I called down again and asked when he was planning on making an appearance as I would like to get some sleep if possible - he sighed, said "yeah, yeah, yeah I'm on my way" and hung up. He did come up a few minutes later and messed around with the lights until he figured it out (basically the switch is this weird dimmer circle which you apparently have to press 15 times to get it to (either) turn off OR go super bright - basically, they are glitchy and need to be replaced. 5. I was woken every 20 minutes the entire night by what sounded like a passing train (it must be near a railway because the mirrors shook each time one went by). I stay in Paris frequently and can say that this is not a 4 star hotel in terms of service, maybe if you are not in a rush/have a strong desire sleep when you stay at a hotel it might be better for you - I can only speak for myself. I would much sooner recommend Le Meridien Etoile, the prices are comparable, the rooms are far better equipped and the service runs smoothly. That's my two cents!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning romantic hotel in a gorgeous neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: donnalw
Reviews.Content: An absolutely amazing hotel. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Stayed in a superior room, was worth the extra money. Rooms spacious and tidy.Maid service incredible. Returned from a hectic day in the city to a beautifully cleaned room,. Made our trip thoroughly enjoyable.The Metro stop is a two minute walk in a wonderful neighbourhood. Will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser10
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Banville offers a wonderful mix of Parisian sophistication and hospitality. The staff was friendly, energetic and extremely patient with my poor attempts to speak French. Our room was lovely. When I visit Paris, I will stay at this hotel again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DankarAustralia
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon after many good reviews and were not dissapointed! We booked on wotif for "room only", and they upgraded our room on arrival and also included breakfast. Females at reception are particulary helpful and friendly. Hotel rooms are not huge but are adequate for Paris. Hotel is about 10 mins walk to the Arch De Triomphe and there are plenty of the good restraunts in the area. We would reccommend highly this small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Enchanting Experience”
Reviews.Author: aluckypenny
Reviews.Content: In late February my husband, Tom and I stayed at the Hotel De Banville in the 17th Arrondisement in Paris, France. We have stayed at this hotel for over a decade, but this trip was exceptionally wonderful! The Hotel De Banville has gone through a lot of renovation over the past few years, and their latest is simply magical! When we stay at the Hotel we reside in their Apartment de Marie, which is on the top floor. Since our last visit in October 2009, this space has been completely renovated, as well as a new 'lift' installed. The Apartment de Marie has always been a delight to stay in, particularly because of the view of the Eiffel Tower and the Arch de Triumph that can be seen from the apartment. However, since its renovation, it feels like being on top of the world in a white castle with great attention paid to the colors and furnishings!! The living room now has an entire wall of windows opening up a vista view of Paris. It felt like pure fantasy during our stay. You can luxuriate in the six foot plus bathtub while enjoying the incredible skyline of Paris. Especially in the evening when the Eiffel Tower has twinkling lights all around that seem to reach to the sky. On top of that, is the Tuesday Evening Piano Bar experience, which now includes additional musicians and singers. And, as if all of that weren't enough, the service at this hotel seems to grow ever better with their physical improvements. I have recommended this Hotel to several of my friends, and they all return to the States with huge gratitude for the accomodations and se rvice provided by the Hotel staff. Yes, we all had to suffer a bit during the renovations, but that is done now, and it is simply a 'slice of heaven' on earth. You will love your visit to the Hotel de Banville, and you definitely won't want to miss this experience. Michele Balk

Reviews.Title: “Breath of French air!”
Reviews.Author: Agi_pl
Reviews.Content: A soon as you walk in you feel the unique climat of that lovely butique hotel. Great welcoming staff, always there when you need help, it was our first visit to Paris and they've made it so easy. Charming interiors were seen even in the lift, I wouldn't take to many bags with me in it (quite small) but how wonderful it was! Very good metro connection to all parts of Paris and the best bakery in the city just round the corner. Very clean but a bit warm rooms.

Reviews.Title: “"omg you need to see to believe"”
Reviews.Author: shazzyinverness
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel from friday 12th march until monday 15th march for our 25th wedding anniversary and we cannot find one single fault other than we had to leave and return home!!! . there was a slight mix up at the airport and we were late arriving we had booked the shuttle service on offer but when we arrived we were met by members of staff and our bags were taken for us to our room then we were told because of mix up we were being upgraded to the room amelie!!!!!!!!!!!!! words cannot describe the room but i will try : soft lighting, tastefully decorated in white and siver/grey, under floor heating and a most luxurious bath and bath room . in the bathroom there was french windows which you could open and have a most wonderful view ,as you relaxed in the glorious bath tub.in the bedroom the french windows opened to reveal a balcony complete with a table and two chairs overlooking the eiffel tower absolutley unique! !the ceiling above the bed had about 12 round mirrors and this was also the case in the ceiling above the bath!!!in the morning we ordered the breakfast yes at 20 euros expensive but my goodness to sit out on that balcony eating it just wonderful (no extra charge ) and it was lovley and filling. we found the staff all to be helpful friendly and personable they all spoke good english too and wanted to make your stay special and special it was!!!!!!!!!!!! i have read many reviews moaning about the lift but we found it to be like the rest of the hotel charming !yes it was small reminded us of a tardis but it had a lovely ding dong when you reached your destination. nearby their was plenty shops bistros and cafes, the arc de truimph about 20 min walk the metro was nearby although we never used it as we had tickets for the hop on hop off bus .we really could not rate this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a 4 Star "Classic" !!”
Reviews.Author: Wiser7948
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a "classic" room on the 5th floor ....obviously the cheapest option available within the hotel, but at 150 Euros a night for room only, thats not cheap !! Upgrades were on offer but at an additional 50 Euros per night for the superior (without a view) and extortinate amounts if you wanted the view or a higher class suite. The room was basic, small and smelt badly of old tobacco and smoke. As mentioned by other reviewers, there were stains on the bedspreads and the walls were generally dirty and required urgent painting. In addition, (a British thing) but there were no coffee / tea making facilities ...but a pricey mini bar was available as an alternative if you required a drink. Sadly, the room did not reflect the quality of the rest of the hotel which generally was exceptionally clean and well laid out. Have since noted comments by the manager about rooms being decorated in December ...but can advise that this has clearly not happened. The bedroom window looked out into a courtyard and was surrounded by other similar high rise appartments. The bathroom was very acceptable although dark with average lighting. On a plus side for the hotel, I must mention the free glass of Champagne provided by the hotel management ( thank you Emmanuel) in celebration of our wedding anniversary ...and recovery from a nightmare Eurostar journey due to the snow. It was most appreciated and we enjoyed the drink curled up against the lovely fire ! I cannot agree about the negative attitude of the staff as mentioned in other posts as we found them all to be very accomodating and helpful throughout our stay. The Metro is within walking distance, but you are still some 20 mins + from the main attractions and not on a direct line. However, I must say the transportation systems were excellent value for getting around. There are several cafe / bistro's in the area for breakfast and have to agree with other travellers that the 20 Euros charged by the hotel was excessively high. The hotel is certainly not 4 Star and would recommend anyone looking for accomodation to stay nearer the centre of town where I am sure you will find a better quality hotel for the same amount of money. .....and before the manager puts his comments on the site ...there were no FREE upgrades available if you were unhappy with the room !! Enjoy Paris ...it's fantastic and a wonderfully romantic city ...even though we froze !!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel in a convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: StrappySandals
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent a few nights here for a little getaway. It was a great value at $200/nt for the quality of hotel that you get. The location was alright. You could walk if it's a nice day or there's a train station not far away. The staff was average. They were a bit terrible at giving restaurant recommendations and returning our calls, but come prepared and you'll be fine. We were able to get taxis called on time, which was important. The rooms were nice. I think they are all different, but ours was quite cozy and had a view over the inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful French gem”
Reviews.Author: LaurieMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: OK - two complaints first - sometimes the response to emails comes slowly and make sure when they tell you where the driver will pick you up from the airport, they are SPECIFIC! Other than that, I loved, loved, loved this hotel - small rooms, but it is Paris - the staff is lovely, you wake to the smell of croissants and if you get Amelie - the view of the Eiffel Tower from your window. The metro and bus is right around the corner - so easy and safe to use. But, the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe - we put our pillows at the foot of our bed so we could see it last thing at night and first thing in the a.m. We had a gorgeous claw footed tub, very comfortable bed, a great little balcony and they send us a great bottle of champagne because we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. What a city, what a hotel - we will be back - perhaps we will stay in Sophie? Oh, yeah, my best advice for travelers to Paris? Forget fashion - wear the most comfortable (yet stylish) shoes you own! Also, splurge and reserve a table (3 months in advance) at Jules Verne at the Eiffel Tower - incredible!!

Reviews.Title: “poor start, good finish.....”
Reviews.Author: gubette
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel after lots of research online, this hotel seemed to be perfect for our budget and requirements. It also had good reviews. However, after arriving at the hotel will we meat by a surely and obviously uninterested receptionist, who seemed most annoyed that we interrupted her phone call . We checked in and were allocated room 41. After shoehorning ourselves (we are slim by the way) into the smallest lift in the world, we arrived on the 4th floor, immediately l turned right and to our dismay found that out room was right next to the offending lift. To be fair, there was no lift noise. There was however the most annoying, loud, vibrating hum that we never found the source of in the room. It seemed as if the outer wall was vibrating. The room was unbelievably shabby with stains on the carpets and on the walls and smelt of cigarettes. As for the (lack of) paint on the window sills and no double glazing and even the windows didn't close properly. Even the air con was broken. After complaining to the uninterested receptionist, she told us that there was nothing to be done until the morning when we could change rooms. The bathroom though was good however. This was not the start of our romantic birthday weekend celebrations that we had envisioned and not up to standards for a so called 4 star hotel. Breakfast was nice and of the continental variety, but was a bit strange having it in the lobby, as people were coming in and out and also checking in and out as well. Once we changed rooms though, it was good and our room was a vast improvement thankfully and our weekend break could start. It felt that we were put into that room as we booked online on travel supermarket and most people would maybe put up with it. But as we spend nearly 300 nights a year in hotels, we know what to expect and how to be treated. at 310 euro a night, you expect a hell of a lot more. As for location and charm, all good. Close to the tube and all amenities. We would recommend this place but don't accept sub standard rooms. You deserve more and they need to bring room 41 (and any other ones in a similar state) to the same standards as all the other rooms. This isn't a cheap hotel and all the rooms should reflect this.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DonMelchor
Reviews.Content: I was told that hotels in Paris are generally average. De Banville was excellent in every respect! The receptionists were very friendly and all of them could speak English fluently. The other staff were polite and discreet. The room was very stylish and elegant (see photos although rooms differ from one another), nice bed, good TV set and powerful air conditioning (which is quite useful in the summer). Once you find your way to Arc de Triomph from then on it will take a 15 min to walk there but it's somewhat a pleasant experience as you walk pass nice restaurants, some shops and a small park. The underground station is a 30 seconds walk from the hotel and there are some bistros around as well as a McDonalds for those you care for fast food. We has breakfast included in our stay and I recommend that you do as well. The breakfast was very good (eggs, ham, croissant, other pastry, nutella chocolate, womens' yogurts, cereals, tin fruit. orange juice, coffee). The price is cheaper compared to nearby bistros for the quality and quantity of food. This hotel is suitable for couples but I also saw families with children (babies and teens). When I visit Paris de Banville will certainly be my choice (and I am already looking forward to it)!

Reviews.Title: “We thought this hotel was terrific”
Reviews.Author: DavidandEmma
Reviews.Content: When reading other reviews of this hotel I was a little concerned at the one or two negative reviews that it had received. I needn't have worried. We were in Paris for a romantic weekend without the children and this hotel was perfect. Charming inside and out, the reception was warm and welcoming and the staff excellent. Our room was small but comfortable, and clean. The contintental breakfast was lovely. The hotel is a bit of a walk from some of the major tourist destinations but the metro is only 300 yards away and easy to use. We had a great time and can't recommend this hotel highly enough. But if a small room, slow, old-fashioned lift and quiet charm would irritate you, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff. Excellent Location. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mcrespi
Reviews.Content: My two kids and I stayed for 2 nights. Very comfortable room and a nice bathroom. Excellent breakfast even at odd hours. Very good location. Half a block from a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming boutique hotel in Paris suburbs!!”
Reviews.Author: Luigi2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2nd leg of our honeymoon and chose the hotel on the back of some great reviews on trip adviser. The hotel really was better than we expected, and the small balcony and view of the eiffel tower from our room (the Amelie room) was so fantastic, especially at night when the eiffel tower was brilliantly lit up on the Paris skyline. The room was gorgeous, with a free standing bath, his and hers sinks and as I mentioned, the amazing terrace, which was perfect for two people to share a lovely glass of wine out there, and we had breakfast out there most mornings. It was bigger than we expected and you got lovely robes and slippers to lounge around in. The hotel staff were also fantastic, the breakfasts were lovely, and the free tickets for the boat ride down the seine were a lovely extra. This hotel is sitiuated in really pretty surroundings, with lots of very nice restaurants nearby and it was so nice to be away from the main attractions, but near enough that we could get to them easily when we needed to. We walked nearly everywhere, as the streets were so interesting to explore, but it was very easy to get to and use the metro if needed. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris, though beware that the hotel do not accept travellers cheques (we had bought these to pay for our stay).

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: slimmer1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our last night of a two-week vacation in Paris/south of France. Room was clean and recently renovated. Bathroom was a little cramped - toilet was set right against the towel warmer, which would force one to sit sideways. Shower stall was small and allowed for water to splash on to tile outside easily. Front desk was very friendly and gave a great recommendation for dinner that evening.

Reviews.Title: “not the honeymoon of my dreams, but it was ok..”
Reviews.Author: mhtsaras
Reviews.Content: me and my husband chose this hotel for our honeymoon.. the hotel has a boutique style and for this reason the furniture are old but very nice decorated.. we stayed at the 7th floor for 7 nights, which had a nice view of the top of the eiffel tower as i found the amelie room, which was higher a bit expensive. the room was extremely clean and the girls at the reception very kind and willing to help you. Great pillows and bed. nice location near to metro not far from the center if you like to walk 15 minutes till arc de triumf and 45 minutes for the eiffel tower. Breakfat was good, nothing special than the usuall. Friendly staff. Everything was nice but i would like a bit more for a hotel paid 200 euros per night and for so long stay

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: katyerik08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are in our late 20's and over the holiday season we took a trip to Europe. It was my first trip. We went to London, Edinburgh, and Paris. My boyfriend is an Event Producer and I have an events background - so as you can assume, we are big planners. I was most excited about our romantic white winterland leg of the trip in Paris. We got recommendations from friends on everything - attractions to visit, places to eat, and most importantly, a reasonable, but ozzingly romantic place to stay. A childhood friend of my boyfriends recommended Hotel De Banville. His family had been staying there for 15+ years. He had stayed there on his first and only visit to Paris and fell in love with it as his family had and overwhelming convinced us that it would be the perfect romantic boutique hotel experience for us in Paris. Qualities that the Paris hotel had to have for us was: a smaller boutique feel with wonderful decor, romantic rooms, area of town that we could navigate to the attractions easily, breakfast included, and all for under $250 (US) a night. Hotel de Banville had all of that and beyond! They even had a lift, fluffy robes, hair dryers, big closets, tremendous service, and a wonderful breakfast that we could enjoy in bed. You can tell by the pictures I'm posting that it truly was enchanting. The service was impeccable, the breakfast in the morning was heavenly, the accommodations were above and beyond comfy - especially for European standards. We were sad that we missed the owners playing live jazz and will definitely arrange our schedule next time so we can see them perform during our next stay at Hotel de Banville. I will recommend to anyone and everyone taking a trip to Paris for the rest of my life! It really made our Paris trip magical.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ellesbelles57
Reviews.Content: I have jsut returned from Paris having spent a pleasant weekend there. Now I am not one to criticise unduly, nor do I go on holiday with unrealistic expectations but having read the reviews on here and seen the beautiful photos on the website I was a little disappointed with the hotel. The building itself is magnificent, and the reception was beautifully presented. It was very clean and a helpful friendly desk clerk who could not have been more helpful. So far so good. However, the room was in fact rather small, and I was given twin beds (despite a specific request for a double room). The bathroom was also very small. It was tastefully decorated, but certainly not to the luxurious standard that the featured rooms implied. Had I have been staying for a longer period then I would have asked to move, as it was it was fine for my needs, just not, as I say, the top range I had expected. I did not eat in the hotel, so cannot comment on that. As to the location, it was a litle out of the way, which suited me fine as I did not want to be in the hustle bustle, and it is close to the metro. All in all, I would say a pleasant hotel with a lovely "boutiquey" feel, but not quite the top end the photos on the site would convey.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD GO BACK IN A HEARTBEAT”
Reviews.Author: widgeon488
Reviews.Content: The service was great, the breakfast was also very good. The hotel and rooms are very charming. The hotel is very close to the metro which was very convenient. The very best thing about the hotel was the receptionist Florence. She was very charming and friendly. She was very helpful with our daily excursion planning. Our experiece in Paris would not have been as good without her expertise. I am sorry that I did not get to hear the owner sing and play the piano and to tell her what an asset and gem she has in Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for 2 people, not for 3..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whilst overall this was a lovely hotel with friendly staff and a great breakfast, they should never have said that they had a triple room. We booked this hotel having asked if they had triple rooms, and specifically asking for a large room so that we'd have plenty of space. Before going to Paris we were assured this was the case. For 3 people, the room we were given was very small (although perhaps adequate for 2). Everything was laid out for 2 people, and whilst the converted sofa (sofa with cushions removed) was comfortable, there was very little room for our (small) suitcases. There were no alternatives offered when I complained. I also expected that the location would be much more central. Although it was very close to the metro, we did not feel safe using the metro late at night and needed to use taxis every evening to get to the popular night spots. I felt that the internet did the hotel more justice in terms of location than it deserved. All in all, I expected a lot more. The room was small, and though clean and nicely decorated, was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: honeybear12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here after the glowing reviews. The reviews were on the mark. We spent 10 days at the hotel. We stayed in Les préludes. The decor was beautiful and the ambiance very romantic. Its not in the center of the city but the metro was only blocks away. The room service was amazing, we could leave our room at 6pm in the evening and our room would be sparkling by the time we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel de Banville”
Reviews.Content: I arranged a 3 night stay at the Hotel de Banville in December to propose to my girlfriend. Booking direct via the hotel's website we had a great deal I contacted in advance the hotel to arrange chocolates, flowers etc and the hotel staff did a wonderful job decorating our room. We stayed in the Marie suite the first night (unavailable the next 2) and this was the most gorgeous room, so peaceful, romantic and with amazing views of the Tower We had never been to Paris before but found the Hotel, the location, the staff, travelling around etc so easy and do not let the location put you off this hotel. The Metro is so simple to follow a just a couple of minutes stroll and you are on your way We will definitely return to this hotel and would like to thank the hotel staff again for making our stay so special Paul and Lilian Wirral, UK

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a few dissappointments”
Reviews.Author: alexnkev
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise romantic getaway for my boyfriend and also to celebrate my birthday. We stayed in the Theodore de Banville room on the 6th floor and it was gorgeous! We could see the top of the Eiffel Tower shimmering at night. The breakfast was yummy too. the location was fine once we used the metro, but it took us over an hour to walk back from the Eiffel Tower. Due to the huge choice of hotels in Paris, I chose it mainly because of the beautiful interior and also 3 USPs: 1. the owner of the hotel singing Tuesday night 2. the hotel offering a cake with candles for my birthday 3. the hotel offering a present for my birthday. Unfortunately, there was no singing on the Tuesday night - perhaps because this was so close of New Years Eve? but no-one told us. Secondly there was no cake. The hotel said they'd tried. Thirdly we did receive a gift, but only one and as we already had one included in the hotel package, I felt we missed out. These three things may seem minor in themselves, but coupled with the high price of the hotel when we stayed, would put me off staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: aussieDubrovnik
Reviews.Content: Nice, warm, family hotel with good service and easy walking distance to some tourist sights as well as the bus or metro to the others. Only remark is the rooms could have better isolation, but all in all we definitly recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Intimate hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonWoodstock
Reviews.Content: We had a great two nights in the Hotel de Banville. It is fun, fashionable and friendly with a relaxed, intimate atmosphere. Our room was a little small but beautifully presented so the size really wasn't much of an issue. It was well located and there was secure parking close by. Breakfast was simple and served in the lobby. My husband felt the lobby might be trying to do too much accommodating breakfast each morning but I felt it was fine. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abzsafado
Reviews.Content: Fantastically romantic and charming hotel, situated in one of the best areas of Paris. Couldn't have chosen a better hotel for the price we paid. It is not without it's flaws eg: the elevator is old and slow, but generally it's faults added a bit to it's charm. We spent three nights here on a romantic break and felt more like guests in someones house than customers in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!!”
Reviews.Author: pippao86
Reviews.Content: Unforgettable sums up our stay completely in this most beautiful Paris hotel. Other words I would use would include, tranquil, perfect, relaxing, stunning... I could go on but I believe that you are getting my point. I booked this hotel directly for my partners 25th birthday as a surprise. I got everything and more that I asked for which is the way I believe it should be. We booked the Amelie room - which in itself was a particular treat - with beautiful decoration, a stunning bathroom and the most spectacular view of the Eiffel Tower from the balcony. You can even catch a view of the top of the Arc de Triumph and other monuments if you have a beady eye. There was little noise from the hotel or the surrounding area, which made this stay very peaceful. In addition, I found the hotel staff to be fantastic. In particular, Blerina - here is a personal thank you to you - you helped make my partner’s birthday sublime by helping organise champagne and birthday decorations for our room - this was the cherry on top for our stay!! I truly believe that I could write an essay about just how magnificent this hotel was, the staff, and the room the location, but I appreciate that there is not time. What I will end with is that if you are planning a trip to Paris, and you want to do things the Paris way (luxury, beauty) - this hotel is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Magicmange
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for D' Arc horse races and booked Hotel de Banville by accident as this was nearby the hotel where our friends were staying. Very pleasant surprise. Feeling of a classic modern boutique hotel with great service, newly renovated rooms with bed rooms in a classic style and bathrooms super modern, nice breakfast and very private. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a romantic weekend in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie_RSA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 7 nights in hotel de Banville as part of our honeymoon in Paris. Our suite (Marie) is situated on the top floor, offering magical views Paris has to offer: Arc de Trompie and the Eiffel Tower. This particular room was massive and tastefully decorated with lovely open plan bathroom. The front desk staff were very friendly and had a good command of the English language (nice surprise). The hotel is situated in a very nice, quite and upmarket neighborhood of Paris; easy access (10 minutes walk) to the Metro station and Metro buses (Porte de Champerette). It is also surrounded by numerous top class restuarants. If style, comfort, elegance and romance is what you are looking for, Banville is for you. Banville surpassed all our expectations from a hotel in Paris. Would we returm to this hotel: plans are already in motion to celebrate our 1st anniversary next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickTR
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Hotel De Banville for 1 night but it was a fantastic experience. The hotel is situated in a quiet district about 10-15 mins metro from the central shopping disctricts. The hotel is beautifully furnished from top to bottom. We stayed on the top floor in the Amelie sweet which was great. The boutique style room had a great bathroom separated by thick curtains and a small balcony with a great views across Paris and of the Eiffel Tower. The management were friendly and really helpful and brought up an amazing breakfast to our room - even after breakfast had finished! We had slept in an hour late, having not re-set our watches! And we checked out an hour late, without a single word of complaint! All in all, it made our very short stop in Paris fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sarah2210
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room through Airmiles for a long weekend to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. I was impressed from the second we walked in through the doors. The foyer was small but beautifully presented and, more importantly, clean. Checking was easy, we were given a map with the hotel and nearest metro station clearly marked on it. Our room was on the 5th floor, we rode up in the smallest lift I've ever been in but that just made us smile. Our room was very clean and light, the bathroom was cleaner than some hotels I've been in and the power shower was exactly that unlike most hotel showers!! Our booking included breakfast which was served in the lobby or you could have it in your room. There was ample food available and the staff didn't look surprised when I ordered an omelette instead of eating croissants etc with my husband (I have a wheat allergy) and it was a far nicer omelette than I can make myself!! In short, great hotel, comfortable bed and friendly staff, I swear they had a bell attached to the front doors so they could greet you just as you had one foot in the building. Can't wait to book our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful De Banville”
Reviews.Author: torino20
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the de Banville to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Everything already written on these pages about the hotel is spot-on. I am a Travel Agent and have stayed in many hotels but this hotel is one of the best. In a nice quiet residential area of Paris with some great restaurants close by (try San Remo's if you like Italian) and a pleasant 15 minute walk to the Arc de Tromphie. We stayed in the "Ameile" room. The room was very cosy with a lovely claw-foot bath to relax in after a full day visiting the sights. We also had a great view of the Eiffel Tower/Arc de Tromphie and a small balcony with table & chairs where we ate breakfast one morning. What more can one ask for! As a bonus at night, you get the chance to sit on the balcony and watch the Eiffel Tower's spectacular light show. The staff were extremley polite and helpful and spoke fluent English and the service was excellent. We requested a private car transfer from Gare de l'Est which the hotel provided for 25 Euros. Well worth doing to save queing for a taxi especially at 10pm at night. The driver was so helpful and polite and on our return to the Gare Du Nord to catch the Eurostar he even took our luggage all the way up to the check-in. Breakfast was also very good (croissants, cold meats etc.) and kept one going until a lunch-time snack. We can't wait to return again and stay in the lovely "Ameile" room. Tip For Sightseeing: Use L'Open Bus Tour. Bus stop near Arc de Tromphie. 4 routes, jump on/off at any stop and includes boat that runs up/down the Seine. Great way to see Paris and all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “All that we had hoped for ...and more!”
Reviews.Author: esheeDublin
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at the Hotel for my 4th July birthday back in March. I had read up on many reviews on Trip Advisor adn knew we were in for a treat! The hotel exceeded our expectations! Our driver was late coming to collect us at the airport (we think he forgot us) but the hotel were very apologetic , as was the driver! When we arrived , the first thing I was greeted with was a 'Happy Birthday" and told to enjoy some champagne on behalf o fthe hotel which was very nice! Our room, L'apartment de Marie was ready for us on arrival and it is such a beautiful Paris room, up on the 8th floor with such a fantastic view of the tower, the arc de triomphe and even sacre couer in the distance! Every member of staff were so friendly, helpful, approachable, always smiling and asking how you were! I dealt with Alexandre on reception in many e-mails and she was wonderful. Our favorites about the hotel would be the turn down service of the bed in evening, when they left the bedside lamps on low lighting with little chocs on pillow. Breakfast brought to room in morning! Lots of little extras in room, good magazines and Paris books, plenty of soaps, shampoos replaced every day! My boyfriend loved that the stocked the Guardian newspaper every day too! Overall service was top class! We expected the hotel to be in a nice location, but a little away from the main attractions,in reality it is much closer than we thought! The Arc de Triomphe is honestly only a 15 min max walk from hotel (a lovely walk), we strolled home from Dinner beside Tuilleries gardens one night and it took max 35 mins, again a lovely walk through Paris! Pack your comfy shoes and enjoy strolling through the streets. Area hotel is in is gorgeous, lots of nice brasseries on Perreire roundabout down the street, buzzes with Parisian charm! I agree with one other reviewer that I don't want to tell too many people about this place in case it becomes too busy and loses its charm!!!!! We will most definitely be back to the Hotel de Banville!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBob
Reviews.Content: Had a short stay here. The location is better if you have been to Paris before. For a first time traveller to Paris it is probably a bit far away from the main tourist sites. Having said that it is only a 15 minute metro ride into the main tourist sites. The staff we came across were very nice and helpful. Our room was on the top floor with a fantastic view of Paris including the Arc de Triomphe and the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Banville!!”
Reviews.Author: firstenburg
Reviews.Content: Our company paid for us, so I wasn't concerned about the price. The hotel is very expensive, I think it was 240 euros / night. It was a lovely experience!! The hotel was in great condition, with a lovely entrance and a grand piano in the lobby. Some nights there was live music played there. They offered internet in the lobby, and the breakfasts were very good! The staff was extremely helpful. Even though we arrived 3 hours before check-in, they held our bags for us, no problem, and we toured the city until it was time to check in. We were on the 7th floor and loved the view. However we didn't enjoy the elevator ride much. It was only a minor inconvenience, but there is only one, and it is TINY. The hotel is only 200 meters or so from a metro stop. And the way the Paris metro works you are only 10-20 minutes from all the major tourist attractions. There are plenty of great restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel, and the Arc de Triumph is within walking distance. The rooms are good sized, with marble bathrooms. Our bathroom was very modern, while other rooms we saw had roman style bathrooms. All of which were great! Plenty of hot water. And there was a clothing warmer rack thing too. The only negatives were that the "double" bed was really 2 twins pushed together, and a MAJOR mishap on our first night there: my wife and were on the bed, in our underwear, and a hotel employee unlocked our door and entered the room without knocking!! His job is to place the chocolates on the pillows. I got all over the hotel for this and they appologized profusely. But still, c'mon....

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at deBanville”
Reviews.Author: uplanderbob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 6 nights at hotel deBanville (both planned and unplanned nights). Our intent was to celebrate her 60th birthday with 5 days in Paris then move on for a week in Provence. Unfortunately our trip got off to a rocky start as a result of various missed flight connections then with my wife contracting sometype of intestional bug which caused us to cancel the last half of the trip. Throughout our difficulties, the staff at the hotel was both sympathetic and most cooperative in tracking lost luggage, securing medical assistance and making sure we could stay additional nights at the hotel until we could arrange for an early flight home. During our stay I noticed that the staffing levels were quite high for a relatively small hotel (less than 40 rooms). This resulted in a high level of personal service. Also when we first made our reservations I noticed that the manager responded to all complaints posted on this site. He may not have been able to resolve every complaint but his public efforts in this regard influenced our decision to stay at the de Banville. The hotel is located in a residential neighbhorhood that was fun to explore. A metro stop is close by and you can be at most of the major sites within 15-20 minutes. Say hello to the staff for me when you visit the hotel. Regards Bob Howse

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel De Banville”
Reviews.Author: Ryana2
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay at this hotel and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff were very friendly, (excellent english, which is great when your French ain't up to scratch!). Room was nice and clean. We didn't have a bath in our particular room which disappointed me a little. But when I did give the shower a go, it was just amazing! Nice powerful shower and hot water whenever you want it, which meets my criteria for a shower! Small bathroom but nicely decorated and nice little extras such as shampoo, shower gel , cotton buds etc. I had asked for a bottle of champagne to be in our room on arrival(as it was my boyfriends birthday) and they kindly obliged, even adding a few bowls of nice niblies! The hotel itself is a little away from the main centre of paris, but right next to a metro which can take you anywhere you want to go. We had breakfast included during our stay and it was spot on. Selection of cereals, breads, eggs, fruit, teas coffees. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience paris in fun, luxurious and clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris find!”
Reviews.Author: Wild_Panther
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 night in hotel de Banville as part of our honeymoon in France. We are very glad that we found this hotel! Our room (Amelia) on the top floor was clean, nicely decorated with excellent open-plan bathroom and lovely romantic balcony overlooking the Eiffel Tower. We chose this specific room on the hotel website and were glad hotel staff made sure Amelie was kept for our stay. Hotel staff was very friendly and make great breakfast in bed; and sandwiches and espresso in the downstairs bar. Hotel is situated in a quite, clean and up market neighborhood. Within 3 mins walk of the hotel there is a roundabout that has around 10 different restaurants / bistro, plus another 10 restaurants within few more mins walk. Also 15 minutes away is the Arc de Triumph, so good location! Overall great stay that we really enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem! We really loved it!”
Reviews.Author: blod000
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a 4 day break at the beginning of April for my 40th birthday. We had used Trip Advisor to choose this hotel and booked via AirMiles. I should say straight away that we are fussy. I hate dirt, unkemptness etc and was apprehensive about going. I really needn't have been as this hotel is absolutely marvellous. I can't recommend this strongly enough. We stayed in the Prelude room for a supplement per night. The room and the hotel is clean, romantic and has a certain elegance which brings a special air to any special occasion. The main foyer/bar area is lovely and has a real touch of class. Unfortunately, my husband fell as we walked around Paris on our first day. This gave us lots of opportunity to use all the hotel's facilities as I nursed him before travelling home on the 4th day. Room service (breakfast, lunch and dinner) was great, dry cleaning is prompt and done well, there is access to the internet in the main lobby, the rooms are clean, well decorated and appointed with everything one could need, but the real praise must go to the owner of this family run business and her handpicked staff. Each member of staff no matter what their job (both daytime and night-time staff) treated us like members of the family and did all they could to help us and offer us a special stay. This really did feel like a home from home and with my husband so poorly, this was really welcome. We had a taxi (arranged by the hotel before arrival from CDG to the hotel). The driver is lovely and helped us greatly. If you are looking for a hotel with style, class, elegance and romance, where every personal touch and attention to detail is given to your stay, then this is the one. The metro and local buses are within close walking distance and the area is lovely and exactly what I expected from a holiday in Paris. Would we return? Most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend break”
Reviews.Author: ADWLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel de Banville via AirMiles after good reviews. Arrived at the hotel to find that the booking had not been received! Luckily they had rooms available and the staff were very helpful in sorting this out. We were allocated a room on the back of the hotel, which initially looked small and a little dark. However, on further inspection the furnishings were of very high quality and everything was immaculately clean. The bathroom was again small, but well furnished, with a lovely powerful shower. A quick look into other rooms while they were being cleaned showed they are all differently decorated and furnished, but of a similar size. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and you could take breakfast in your room at no extra cost - lovely! The hotel is out of the main tourist areas, being about 15 mins walk to the Arc de Triumphe and Trocadero. However, it was peaceful and quiet, with a Metro and RER stop very close by. Despite the initial hitch, I would highly recommend this hotel - however, I would ask for a room on the front - they were brighter.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon elegance with calla lily style”
Reviews.Author: Carole_Daniel
Reviews.Content: In October, 2007, we spent the first night of our honeymoon in the Hotel Banville and we could not have been more pleased. The hotel lobby is lovely, our charming room (Theodore Banville) was designed to perfection, and the welcoming proprietor of this personal, boutique hotel was delightful and friendly. Our room had a beautiful custom-built vanity that divided the bed area from the bath area. Custom wood-paneling, wallpaper that matched the bedding, wrought iron balcony -- the whole ensemble made us very happy. The corner bathtub was really unusual and beautiful, positioned under a frosted picture window, transparent at the top so you could see the top of the Eiffel Tower in the distance. The bed and bedding were comfortable and overall, although small, the room conveyed a sense of old-world opulence and comfort. We chose to stay at the Banville because of the beautiful room, pictures of which we had seen on the web page, but also because the proprietress/owner, Marianne, sings jazz and French standards in her piano bar in the lobby on Tuesday nights. Both surpassed our expectations. Marianne – who speaks English impeccably and is very friendly and nice – sings to the accompaniment of an accomplished pianist. We sipped our cocktails from our cushy seats, enjoying the unique blend of modern and traditional décor and every beautiful detail from the calla lilies in the baby grand, to the fabulous custom lighting that appears throughout the hotel. We called out some requests and got up and danced a little swing and foxtrot around the piano, which led to flash bulbs flashing and delightful applause by the "regulars" at the bar and people who worked there. Later that night, upon returning from dinner (Bistro du 17eme, very nice prix fixe including a bottle of wine for two), we found blown-up prints of us dancing left by the hotel for us on our pillow. Breakfast in the lobby was a full assortment of pastries, fruit, cereals, cold cuts, cheese, and of course hot and cold beverages. We were more than satisfied. The staff continued to be so friendly, recalling the dancing from the evening before. We were invited to come back the next Tuesday evening, which we did – this time with some relatives who live in Paris. Everyone had a good time. We would definitely stay again at the Banville (and we’d love to try L’appartement de Marie on the top floor!). Another reviewer says it was very expensive, but actually we were able to get a very reasonable rate (even considering the exchange rate) through our travel agent. It is a beautiful, charming, and inviting hotel, we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Everything GREAT”
Reviews.Author: helveticTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed it this hotel for 2 nights in the room "Marie", 8th floor. Once you have accepted the generally high prices for hotels in Paris, then there is nothing negative to say about this hotel. Au contraire: it's great! Very friendly hotel staff. Super clean rooms. Good food (try have breakfast in the room with view on the Eiffel tower!) Themed rooms (every room seems to be different), great decor. Good location (100m to the metro, 20min to the train station nord/est) The only negative thing would be the very slow lift....but does that really matter? Anyway, try to get a room on the upper floor, street side. And there is one room (Amélie?) which has a baclony and Tour Eiffel view for unforgettable breakfasts) If I am in Paris again, I know where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “A splendid stay”
Reviews.Author: fortune500
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay in Paris and cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We were given an extremely warm and friendly welcome on arrival and were really pleased with our room. We stayed in a superior room - and the views from the balcony were simply stunning. To our delight, we had a fantastic uninterrupted view of the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triomphe and the Sacre Coeur over the Parisian rooftops. The weather was fantastic and the sun streamed into the room. The room was extremely clean, quiet and comfortable and there was a fabulous roll top bath to lie back in whilst admiring the Eiffel Tower shimmering in the evening sky. Every single member of staff we met was so friendly and helpful, which in itself would encourage us to return and stay there again. The hotel is ideally situated for both the metro and RER and we got about Paris with ease. The hotel is in a nice area and there are a great range of restaurants/shops nearby - we particularly loved the restaurant du 17eme in the Place Pereire. Overall, an extremely enjoyable stay and we were sorry to be leaving. We would recommend this hotel to absolutely everyone.
